paqc.utils package¶

Submodules¶

paqc.utils.config_utils module¶

Functions for reading, parsing and sanity checking the YAML config files of the QC pipelines.

paqc.utils.config_utils.config_checker(yml)¶

Parses the YAML config file and checks that the minimum required fields for the general setup of the QC suite and for each QC are present. If the config checking fails at any point, the user is informed about it.

Parameters:yml – Output of config_open().
Returns:Boolean.
paqc.utils.config_utils.config_open(path)¶

Reads in the YAML config file and displays any parsing or formatting errors. If the parsing fails the user is presented with the line that failed. Usually the formatting error is right above this line.

Parameters:path – absolute path to the YAML formatted config file.
Returns:Tuple of Boolean and parsed YAML file. The boolean is indicating whether the opening and parsing of the YAML file was successful, and the YAML config object is a dict of dicts and lists.

paqc.utils.utils module¶

Various general helper functions for the QC package.

paqc.utils.utils.generate_hash(df)¶

Given a pandas DataFrame, this function will generate a unique hash value of it. This enables us to precisely identify which version of a data file the test was carried out on.

Parameters:df – Pandas DataFrame object.
Returns:Hash integer that uniquely maps to a certain DataFrame.
